CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 24, 1959, page 4, reads: "Ride 'Inaugural Special' - Among the 500 well wishers who rode the Allegheny County Democratic 'Inaugural Special' train to Harrisburg. Tuesday, to see and hear Gov. David L. Lawrence accept the oath of office, was this happy group caught by The Courier photographer, just before the train pulled out. Front row, left to right: Mmes. Jean Farrish and Gladys Coffey. Second row, same order: Frank McFann and Milton (Coast) Blout of Homestead; Ralph Mellix, Mrs. Henrietta Fuller, Gladys Coleman and Homestead Councilman Walter Rowe. Third row: Unidentified passenger; Robert E. (Pappy) Williams, Jacob (Jake) Williams and Fred Terry. Fourth row: 'Texas' Polk (face partly hidden), Howard Dammond and John Cundieff. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, front row from left: Jean Farrish, Gladys Coffey; second row: Frank McFann, Milton "Coast" Blout, Ralph Mellix, Henrietta Fuller, Gladys Coleman, Walter Rowe; third row: unknown, Robert E. "Pappy" Williams, Jacob "Jake" Williams, Fred Terry; fourth row: partially visible "Texas" Polk, Howard Dammond, and John Cundieff, on train car for Allegheny County Democratic "Inaugural Special" train to Harrisburg for inauguration of Governor David L. Lawrence
